SEARCH
Package com.sun.faces.cdi

Class ExternalContextProducer

java.lang.Object
com.sun.faces.cdi.ExternalContextProducer
All Implemented Interfaces:
jakarta.enterprise.context.spi.Contextual<ExternalContext>, jakarta.enterprise.inject.spi.Bean<ExternalContext>, jakarta.enterprise.inject.spi.BeanAttributes<ExternalContext>, jakarta.enterprise.inject.spi.PassivationCapable, Serializable
public class ExternalContextProducer extends Object

The ExternalContextProducer is the CDI producer that allows injection of the ExternalContext using @Inject and allows EL resolving of #{externalContext}

Since:
2.3
See Also:
  • FacesContext

  • Constructor Details

    • ExternalContextProducer

      public ExternalContextProducer()

  • Method Details

    • getId

      public String getId()
      Get the ID of this particular instantiation of the producer.

      This is an implementation detail of CDI, where it wants to relocate a particular producer in order to re-inject a value. This is typically used in combination with passivation. Note that this is NOT about the value we're producing, but about the producer itself.

      Specified by:
      getId in interface jakarta.enterprise.inject.spi.PassivationCapable
      Returns:
      the ID of this particular instantiation of the producer

    • destroy

      public void destroy(ExternalContext instance, jakarta.enterprise.context.spi.CreationalContext<ExternalContext> creationalContext)
      Destroy the instance.

      Since most artifact that the sub classes are producing are artifacts that the Faces runtime really is managing the destroy method here does not need to do anything.

      Specified by:
      destroy in interface jakarta.enterprise.context.spi.Contextual<T>
      Parameters:
      instance - the instance.
      creationalContext - the creational context.
